ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned so much about how my body functions anatomically when moving and I had so much fun! This is the best first year seminar. You end up thinking about movement in a completely different way and you subconsciously become so much more aware of how your body moves! Through our readings and movement practices, I learned new things about my movement and I explored ways to make my body move more efficiently. We also had several guest speakers throughout the semester, including a functional anatomy professor at Juilliard (who is an expert in her field) and a ballet costume designer.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: SO many strengths! This class is small so you will develop such strong relationships with your classmates and Professor Robinson and it is overall just so fun! There was never a day I didn't look forward to this class. The only weakness is that Professor Robinson doesn't release grades, so you really have no idea how you're doing in the class. She says we're all doing fine, but that's about it.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: 100% YES take this class!! I know this class is often thought of as a dance first year seminar, but that is absolutely not a prerequisite. We had some students with years of dance experience and one who had never danced, and by the end of the semester we were essentially all in the same place in terms of anatomy. You will learn so much about all forms of movement to apply to everyday life, and Professor Robinson is a gem. This class is also just really fun and very low stress, which makes it a great first year seminar. I just finished my first semester at Yale and I can already tell this will be a class I will remember for years as one of my favorites at Yale.
